preview-html.enableScripts.description: Allow scripts to run in the HTML preview. Must be enabled to use JavaScript, for example when previewing Plotly figures.

preview-html.retainContextWhenHidden.description: Controls if the preview content is kept around even when the panel is no longer visible. This option has a high memory overhead and should only be used if the content cannot be quickly saved and restored.

preview-html.fitPreviewInWindow.description: Controls if the preview content is resized to fit the width and height of the window. If true, the preview is sized to fit the window width and height. Otherwise the preview width is sized to fit the window and the height takes the value defined in the Fit Preview Height setting.

preview-html.fitPreviewHeight.description: Controls the height of the preview content when the Fit Preview In Window setting is false. Value is the height in pixels.

preview-html.updateOnSaveDocument.description: Controls if the preview is synchronized with the document whenever it is saved in an editor. If false, the preview will not reflect saved changes to the document.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
